com.esri.quickstart

Interface EsriQuickStartEventListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener

    public interface EsriQuickStartEventListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    Provides the listener methods for EsriQuickStartLib
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andy Gup

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onAddressResultEvent(EsriQuickStartEvent event, java.util.List<com.esri.core.tasks.ags.geocode.LocatorGeocodeResult> result, java.lang.String exception)
      Indicates that the address Locator service has sent a response payload back to the client.
      void onAddressResultEvent(EsriQuickStartEvent event, com.esri.core.tasks.ags.geocode.LocatorReverseGeocodeResult result, java.lang.String exception)
      Indicates that the address Locator service has a reverse geocode response payload back to the client.
      void onLocationChangedEvent(EsriQuickStartEvent event, android.location.Location location)
      Indicates that the location change has been sent by the LocationService.
      void onLocationExceptionEvent(EsriQuickStartEvent event, java.lang.String message)
      Indicates there has been a location exception thrown by LocationService.
      void onLocationShutdownEvent(EsriQuickStartEvent event, java.lang.String reason)

      Indicates that the base map has loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • onAddressResultEvent

        void onAddressResultEvent(EsriQuickStartEvent event,
                        java.util.List<com.esri.core.tasks.ags.geocode.LocatorGeocodeResult> result,
                        java.lang.String exception)
        Indicates that the address Locator service has sent a response payload back to the client.
        Parameters:
        event -
        result - the List of all results returned by the address geocoder.
        exception - If there was an error look for result to be null.

      • onAddressResultEvent

                        com.esri.core.tasks.ags.geocode.LocatorReverseGeocodeResult result,
                        java.lang.String exception)
        Indicates that the address Locator service has a reverse geocode response payload back to the client.
        Parameters:
        event -
        result -
        exception - If there was an error look for result to be null.
